body: Please update the description to be more descriptive.

@pjain1 could you add the PRs being backported to the title or description? Just asking because that way, the squashed commit message will have them, and the git logs for 0.9.2 will be easier to read.
updated description

üëç @himanshug what are the perf benefits?

I think this is fine for 0.9.2

Some notes on this:
- As far as I can tell, this isn't a regression introduced in 0.9.2 and this was always the behavior when calling /stop (hard interrupt the thread which would cause any future persists to fail)
- The Kafka supervisor doesn't use the /stop endpoint except for shutting down unwanted tasks (either the ingestion schema changed or another replica completed before us) so the MM killing the task probably is not a showstopper. The normal "stop and publish" behavior uses the /offsets/end endpoint to cause the task to "reach the end of its offset assignments" and begin to publish, and that endpoint doesn't do any thread interruption.

I submitted a PR to clean up the /stop endpoint behavior which can definitely be improved.
merged as it had two üëç

Update : we have the same issue with CSV input as well, but that doesn't cause the indexing to fail.
As for Parquet as input - it's possible that some of the fixes applied in the next version (0.9.2) will help overcoming issues with Parquet indexing (e.g #3179 ).

@dclim Thanks for looking into this! Actually, we originally discovered this issue without manually invoking `/stop`, just by running the usual workload on rc1. I started calling it manually to get an easily reproducible test case. Did I understand correctly that this should _not_ happen under normal conditions? If so, then it means that another issue is masked by this one. I'll try and see if I can make a test case that fails without invoking `/stop`, too.

Aha, got it. We occasionally re-submit kafka ingestion supervisor specs to the overlord. At this point, the tasks are [supposed to](http://druid.io/docs/0.9.1.1/development/extensions-core/kafka-ingestion.html#schema-configuration-changes) gracefully shut down and publish what they have.

However, this does not succeed in 0.9.2rc1, apparently because of this:

```
2016-10-05T13:54:10,384 INFO [main] io.druid.query.lookup.LookupReferencesManager - Stopping lookup factory references manager
2016-10-05T13:54:10,384 DEBUG [main-SendThread(localhost:2181)] org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn - Reading reply sessionid:0x15794dc744c0013, packet:: clientPath:/druid/listeners/lookups/__default serverPath:/druid/listeners/lookups/__default finished:false header:: 63,12  replyHeader:: 63,639,0  request:: '/druid/listeners/lookups/__default,T  response::v{'192.168.10.196:8083,'192.168.10.196:8082},s{53,53,1475671310702,1475671310702,0,8,0,0,14,2,639} 
2016-10-05T13:54:10,388 DEBUG [main] io.druid.query.lookup.KafkaLookupExtractorFactory - Topic [exampleLookup] cancelled
2016-10-05T13:54:10,390 DEBUG [main] io.druid.server.lookup.namespace.cache.NamespaceExtractionCacheManager - Did not delete namespace [kafka-factory-exampleLookupbe1f0543-6e54-4f78-9552-a7f407956f11]
2016-10-05T13:54:10,390 ERROR [main] io.druid.query.lookup.KafkaLookupExtractorFactory - Error removing [kafka-factory-exampleLookupbe1f0543-6e54-4f78-9552-a7f407956f11] for topic [exampleLookup] from cache
```

The kafka lookups fail to stop because of this, and the peon process stays alive. It cascades from there, and eventually results in the behavior described originally.

So, it boils down to this:

```
2016-10-05T13:54:10,390 DEBUG [main] io.druid.server.lookup.namespace.cache.NamespaceExtractionCacheManager - Did not delete namespace [kafka-factory-exampleLookupbe1f0543-6e54-4f78-9552-a7f407956f11]
2016-10-05T13:54:10,390 ERROR [main] io.druid.query.lookup.KafkaLookupExtractorFactory - Error removing [kafka-factory-exampleLookupbe1f0543-6e54-4f78-9552-a7f407956f11] for topic [exampleLookup] from cache
```

We do not observe this error in 0.9.1.1. I am currently trying to see if I can figure out why the namespace removal fails, but no fruit yet.

A bit more info: at the beginning of `NamespaceExtractionCacheManager.delete()`, `implData` is empty, so the deletion fails. Since I added logging to all the places (actually, the only place) where something is removed from there, it seems likely that nothing is being put there in the first place.

:+1:

These changes produce an 80% speed-up on some timeseries queries that we were running.  Given that the old groupBy aggregates using the aggregator (which builds a Union implicitly and keeps unioning into it), I don't think this will greatly affect performance there.  But it will significantly speed up timeseries, topN and any other query that depends on the `combine()` function for the merge step.
moving to 0.9.2 since it is ready to be merged.
can you add some UTs? there are plenty of examples in same module. thanks.
@himanshug can you please do a backport PR to 0.9.2?
Yup, I'll add some
@gvsmirnov ah interesting, I've never tried running a kafkaindextask with kafka lookup; I'll give it a try and see if I can reproduce what you're seeing

@dclim  Just to clarify, how I get it to reproduce from a clean state (clean druid 0.9.2-rc1, clean zookeeper, clean kafka):
1. Start zk, kafka, druid
2. Submit a kafka ingestion spec and a kafka lookup
3. Make sure that something is put into relevant kafka topics, and that the tasks are started
4. Re-submit a kafka ingestion spec with the same name (can even submit the same one)
5. Kaboom!

hey @gvsmirnov I was able to repro it and put in a patch that should fix the issue (#3539). The `implData` stuff turned out to be a red herring - there's something not right about the cleanup code there (the kafka lookups don't seem to use the scheduled cache update mechanism that NamespaceExtractionCacheManager.delete() expected it to use) but the real issue is that the Kafka consumer isn't closed properly and has non-daemon threads that keep the process alive.
backporting
@iNikem @Saurabh111191 @itaiy Could you check it's still throws exception with #3544? I'm not using s3 and cannot test that.
I can confirm that with a version built from this branch, the issue I reported in #3531 no longer reproduces. Yay! üéâ
@dclim The patched version works correctly in our tests. Thank you!

@itaiy i don't think that's the issue. According to the carbon server doc `.` and ` `should be replaced but don't think you need to replace`/`or`:` it is working for me and also plenty of other ppls. I am wondering if you have a configuration issue with the carbon server ?
@tigran-a it looks like the same issue to me; are you able to try 0.9.2-rc1 to see if it's fixed there? http://druid.io/downloads.html
@gvsmirnov awesome, thanks for reporting and your help debugging

Thanks for the quick response, @b-slim!
As mentioned above, I'm using [a hosted Graphite service](https://www.hostedgraphite.com/), and they told me those characters are not allowed by Graphite.
I couldn't find something specific in Graphite's documentation, but here are some results from around the web that support this statement (at least for forward slash):
1. https://github.com/dropwizard/metrics/issues/637
2. http://stackoverflow.com/questions/29674488/whitespace-in-statsd-metric-name (the title says "whitespace" but it also refers to slash in the content).
3. https://answers.launchpad.net/graphite/+question/171766
4. http://mingbowan.blogspot.co.il/2012/08/enable-special-character-support-in.html
The last two links are also linked from the StackOverflow question mentioned above.

Given these results, I'm not sure how it even works...
Did you have to apply some specific configuration in your own Graphite to make it work? 
Also - can you refer me to any specific documentation you've seen in regards to this issue?

Thanks again!
any resolution for this?

@itaiy i get your point but i am pretty sure with recent version of carbon sever it worked (as you can see the module has been used by other as well).
now it might be that the hosted version won't accept / and : so i guess the best way to fix this is to inject the pattern of the sanatize regex as part of the config. This will ensure that it is at least backward compatible. Will be happy to see the changes and review the PR ! Thanks for reporting the issue and looking forward for the fix !
btw `/` need to be replace by `.` thought ! since it will be part of metric path.
